entry.title: The Family We Chose
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,220Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 138

Summary: Evan Buckley was truly fucked. One week after leaving the only home heâ€™d ever knownâ€”his parentsâ€™ houseâ€”Ground Zero hit, and the world went to hell. Eight months later, heâ€™s still searching for his sister Maddie in Los Angeles, armed only with a tear-stained note: â€œIâ€™m leaving Doug. Iâ€™m going to Los Angeles.â€ When Buck finally tracks her to Safe Zone 118, he realizes that maybe having a familyâ€”and surviving alongside people who actually careâ€”isnâ€™t so bad. At 118, firefighter Eddie Diaz, a single dad, turned his fire station into a refuge with his team when Ground Zero struck. Just trying to keep his kids safe, heâ€™s thrown for a loop when a stranger shows up claiming to be Maddieâ€™s brother. Buck is skilled, prepared, and oddly magneticâ€”forcing Eddie to question everything he thought he knew about survival, trust, and maybe evenâ€¦ something more.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 549,200Chapters: 60/?Kudos: 69

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children whoâ€™ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: The Weather Outside Is Frightful
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,963Chapters: 3/7Kudos: 28

Summary: Athena plans a Christmas getaway to celebrate Bobbyâ€™s return, but a booking mix-up leaves Buck and Eddie sharing a two-bedroom cabinâ€¦ alone. The rest of the 118 ends up in the bigger cabin (and immediately continues there betting pool), while Chris quietly joins Team â€œMy Dad and Buck Need to Get Together Before Christmas.â€ What follows is a week of accidental coupleâ€™s activities, mistletoe mishaps, disastrous gingerbread houses, Buck teaching Eddie how to ski, snowball fights, and so many almost-moments neither of them will admit to. Buckâ€™s convinced Eddieâ€™s straight. Eddieâ€™s convinced Buck could never want him back.And on Christmas Eve, when a storm traps them in their cabin, they finally have no choice but to talk about everything theyâ€™ve been avoiding. A holiday trip, a slow burn, and two idiots in love trying very hard not to be. Or Buck and Eddie get stuck sharing a cabin during the 118â€™s Christmas vacation, and every holiday trope in existence decides to attack them at once.By Christmas Eve, the only thing more intense than the snowstorm is the truth theyâ€™ve been avoiding.

entry.title: Passing Notes
entry.summary:
Author: writedontfight

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,210Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 123

Summary: Buck's woodworking breakup hobby was short-lived. But he did manage to make one thing that was decent: a Little Free Library. Little did he know, it would bring him something much more exciting than his neighbors' spare books. A rom com-inspired AU - â€œSo, basically, you have a crush,â€ Maddie says with a smirk. â€œWhat? No! Iâ€™ve never had a conversation with him! Hell, I donâ€™t even know what the guy looks like!â€ Buck insists, turning back to the pasta sauce thatâ€™s simmering on the stove. â€œIâ€™m just saying he has really good taste in books, okay?â€ Maddie raises a disbelieving eyebrow. â€œReally good taste, and really queer tasteâ€¦â€ â€œAnd?â€ Buck scoffs. â€œThere are plenty of ugly, awful gay men in Los Angeles. I just got dumped by one.â€ He spoons out a bit of the marinara and holds it out to Maddie. â€œHere, taste this.â€ She does, and narrows her eyes slightly. â€œMm, more basil I think.â€ â€œAre you sure?â€ Buck has a taste of his own and concedes, â€œYeah, youâ€™re absolutely right.â€ â€œI know,â€ Maddie says. â€œIâ€™m right about most things.â€ â€œYouâ€™re right about the basil and only the basil.â€
